subject: 1220a 6/9 Update: Robot arm tested; protruding blanket on rocket pod assessed
body:
1220a 6/9 Update: Robot arm tested; protruding blanket on rocket pod assessed



=================================

CBS NEWS STS-117 STATUS REPORT: 29
Posted: 12:01 AM, 6/9/07

By William Harwood
CBS News Space Analyst

Changes and additions:

   SR-27 (06/08/07): Atlantis rockets into orbit
   SR-28 (06/08/07): NASA managers pleased with performance of repaired external tank
   SR-29 (06/09/07): Pulled-up insulation blanket on rocket pod assessed

=================================

12:02 AM, 6/9/07, Update: Robot arm checked out; protruding blanket seen on OMS pod

The Atlantis astronauts activated and checked out the shuttle's robot arm late Friday and used one of its TV cameras to zoom in on an insulation blanket that appeared to have partially pulled away from the ship's left-side aft rocket pod.

In the video, one corner of the white blanket appeared to have pulled away from an adjacent row of white tiles on the upper surface of the port orbital maneuvering system rocket pod. It wasn't immediately obvious what might have caused the blanket to separate. It did not look serious, but flight controllers asked the crew to pan across the blanet with the robot arm's camera to help them build a three-dimensional image of the area for more detailed analysis.

The astronauts then pressed ahead with a normal payload bay survey before powering the arm down for the night.
